de.stroeer.configurationsdk.model

Class BeaconWithBattery

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractDataModel
      • de.stroeer.model.Beacon
        • de.stroeer.configurationsdk.model.BeaconWithBattery

  • public class BeaconWithBattery
extends Beacon
    A subclass of the Beacon class, adding RSSI management and other functionalities relevant to the Configuration SDK.

      • isCryptoV1

        public boolean isCryptoV1()
        Indicates whether the beacon has one of the CryptoV1 UUIDs. A beacon with one of these UUIDs will be decrypted using the CryptoV1 algorithm.
        Returns:
        true, if this beacon is considered as CryptoV1 beacon, false otherwise.

      • isCryptoV2

        public boolean isCryptoV2()
        Indicates whether the beacon has one of the CryptoV2 UUIDs. A beacon with one of these UUIDs will be decrypted using the CryptoV2 algorithm.
        Returns:
        true, if this beacon is considered as CryptoV2 beacon, false otherwise.

        public void addRssiValue(java.lang.Integer rssiValue)
        This method is only for internal use.

        Adds a new rssi-value to the list of five last rssi-values. If this value is the sixth one the oldest rssi-values is removed.

        Parameters:
        rssiValue - the rssiValue which should be added

      • getDmc

        public java.lang.String getDmc()
        Creates a unique identifier out of major and minor.

        A DMC in the sense of this method is a String with 8 characters following the following pattern: "d" + Major + Minor If the Major of the beacon is no three-digit, left-hand zeroes will be added until this part consists of three characters. If the Minor of the beacon is no four-digit, left-hand zeroes will be added until this part consists of four characters.

        If the Major of the beacon is greater than 999, no DMC can be constructed with this method, returning null. The same applies when the Minor of the beacon is 9999 or the Minor of the beacon is greater than 8191 AND the beacon is encrypted with CryptoV2.

        Note: this DMC must not necessarily be the one you find on the server, as it is constructed using only the stored Major and Minor in the Configuration SDK. No internet connection will be established.

        Returns:
        DMC as String, null if no DMC could be constructed.
